constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 147 (Tuesday, September 13, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. SMITH of New Jersey:
H.R. 8814.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
The Constitutional authority on which this bill is based is
Congress's power under the Commerce Clause in Article I,
Section 8, of the Constitution and under the Constitution's
grant of powers to Congress under the Equal Protection, Due
Process, and Enforcement Clauses of the Fourteenth Amendment.
[Page H7784]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

title: Protecting Pain-Capable Unborn Children from Late-Term Abortions Act
